meanings.definition: A type of coral that forms large, solid structures in tropical seas.
meanings.sent1: The madrepore provides a sturdy home for many sea creatures.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the madrepore to understand coral reef ecosystems.
meanings.sent3: The little fish played hide-and-seek around the madrepore.
meanings.sent4: The madrepore stood tall like a fortress in the underwater world.
meanings.sent5: The colorful madrepore shimmered under the clear ocean water.

meanings.definition: A colony of tiny coral animals that build a hard skeleton.
meanings.sent1: The madrepore colony grows slowly over many years.
meanings.sent2: Divers marveled at the intricate beauty of the madrepore.
meanings.sent3: The madrepore animals had a meeting to discuss their next construction project.
meanings.sent4: The madrepore skeleton was as strong as a castle wall.
meanings.sent5: The delicate madrepore swayed gently with the ocean currents.
